intro: Buphthalmum sericeum, commonly known as the silverleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers with a distinctive yellow center and pale green to silver leaves. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid conditions. Its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance and helping to reduce water loss. Buphthalmum sericeum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
